name: OwaspZapScan
description: Visual Studio Team Services build/release task for running OWASP ZAP automated security tests
author: Kasun Kodagoda

inputs.name: ZapApiUrl
inputs.label: ZAP API Url
inputs.helpMarkDown: The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) with out the protocol. _(Eg. zap.example.com)_

inputs.name: ZapApiKey
inputs.label: API Key
inputs.helpMarkDown: The API key for ZAP. Details about obtaining the API can be found [here](https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/wiki/FAQapikey)

inputs.name: TargetUrl
inputs.label: Target URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target URL where the active scan is performed against.

inputs.name: ExecuteSpiderScan
inputs.label: Execute Spider
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enable to run a spider scan on the target.

inputs.name: RecurseSpider
inputs.label: Recurse
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enable to use the nodes underneath the one specified target to seed the spider.

inputs.name: SubtreeOnly
inputs.label: Subtree Only
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enable to restrict the spider under the target url subtree.

inputs.name: ContextName
inputs.label: Context Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set to constrain the scan to a Context.

inputs.name: MaxChildrenToCrawl
inputs.label: Max Children To Crawl
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set to limit the number of children scanned.

inputs.name: ContextId
inputs.label: Context ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Context identifier of the Scan context

inputs.name: Recurse
inputs.label: Recurse
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set recurse option to scan URLs under the given target URL

inputs.name: InScopeOnly
inputs.label: In Scope Only
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set In Scope only to true to constrain the scan to URLs that are in scope (ignored if a Context is specified)

inputs.name: ScanPolicyName
inputs.label: Scan Policy Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Scan Policy Name allows to specify the scan policy (if none is given it uses the default scan policy)

inputs.name: Method
inputs.label: Method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Allow you to select a given request in conjunction with the given URL

inputs.name: PostData
inputs.label: POST Data
inputs.helpMarkDown: Allow you to select a given request in conjunction with the given URL

inputs.name: EnableVerifications
inputs.label: Enable Verifications
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enable to add thresholds for security risk types and fail the build if the threshold is exceeded.

inputs.name: MaxHighRiskAlerts
inputs.label: High Risk Alert Threshold
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of Maximum allowed High Risk Alerts

inputs.name: MaxMediumRiskAlerts
inputs.label: Medium Risk Alert Threshold
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of Maximum allowed Medium Risk Alerts

inputs.name: MaxLowRiskAlerts
inputs.label: Low Risk Alert Threshold
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of Maximum allowed Low Risk Alerts

inputs.name: ReportType
inputs.label: Report Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the type of report you want generated. Available types are *HTML*, *XML* & *Markdown*

inputs.name: ReportFileDestination
inputs.label: Destination Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: The destination folder that the report file is created. You can use [variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988). Eg.: _$(agent.builddirectory)_

inputs.name: ReportFileName
inputs.label: Report Filename
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the report file, without the extension. Extension is determined by the *Report Type*. Eg. _OWASP-ZAP-Report-2017-00-00_
